What else do you expect to happen with the static class variables. 
There will ever only be one instance of them in the JVM, period.

Why not reset them to their initial state in your TestCase.setUp().

=jason

On Mon, 2002-07-01 at 06:12, qmatthew wrote: Campers,

We are using JUnit 3.7 and mock objects to do our unit testing.  We 
are having some issues whereby the static variables in the mock 
objects are being held in the class loader.  This appears to be 
creating nasty confusion and giving us errors in our tests depending 
on the granularity by which they are run. Our utlimate aim was to 
execute our application test classes through a master TestAll 
however this seems like its not going to work.  Our proposed work 
around is to use ant to identify each test case and run them 
independently.  

Has anyone seen this issue before and are there any suggested work 
arounds ?

Thanks
Matthew.
